page.title: 05Panoramic Photograph
page.content: From the roof of Shiney Row School we were able to take a panoramic photograph which shows the area to the north east of the school. We can see five hills the largest being{Penshaw {Hill}with the monument to Lord Lambton the pit owner. We can also see the man-made hill of{Herrington Pit Heap and to the right of this the winding tower of Herrington Colliery. In front of these hills we can see the{terraced houses}of Shiney Row with their back-yards and{pigeon crees,}the old Miners Welfare Hall, now a jig-saw factory and the new{YMCA}at Herrington Burn. There are the Engine Works and {Bus Depot}at Philadelphia and the new Bungalows at the end of Success Road. In the foreground we can see fields with horses and the{piggery}and the "black path" leading to the{burn} (small stream) and the barley field.
